result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel T. Schreiner was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 07-06-2015:  Court finds defendant eligible for the IDIP Program.
AMENDED 01-04-2016:  Defendant successfully completed the IDIP Program.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and comply with Driver Safety Plan.

timeConds.notes:
After serving the first 48 hours as straight time, work release privileges granted. Court grants good time.
AMENDED 07-06-2015:  Under the IDIP Program, Defendant to serve 182 days with good time and 183 days stayed upon successful completion of the IDIP Program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel T. Schreiner

records.addlTxt:
Discharge Certificate.   Effective 2/17/18, discharged from judgment only.
Civil rights restored:  1)Right to Vote.  2)Obligations for jury duty.
Civil rights not restored:  1)Firearms may not be used or possessed unless a pardon, which does not restrict possession of firearms, is received from the governer.  2)Public office can not be held unless a pardon is obtained from the governor.

IDIP Agreement:
IDIP Program Requirements:  1)Length of IDIP Agreement.  2)Absolute Sobriety.  3)Monitored Sobriety.  4)AODA Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.  5)Payment of IDIP Program Fee.  6)Community Service Work.  7)No violations of law.  8)Other conditions.  9)Violations of the agreement.

Letter to IDIP Coordinator advising Mr. Schreiner has been approved for participation in the IDIP program.  If Mr. Schreiner wishes to participate in the IDIP program, please have him initial and sign 3 copies of the IDIP Agreement. ....

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel T. Schreiner in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution reached, joint recommendation.   Court advises defendant of charge in Count 1/max penalties, felony prohibitions.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court reviewed PLQ/WORF.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence & places defendant on 3 yrs. probation with conditions.  Bond ordered be applied with any balance refunded to person who posted.  Advised of appeal rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant Daniel T. Schreiner in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters requests PLEAS date.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Daniel T. Schreiner in court with attorney Patrick W. Waters.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information not on file.  Atty Waters does not object to using the complaint for information purposes.   DA to follow-up with filing Information.  Court advises defendant of elements of each count as stated in the Complaint & max. penalties and advises defendant of his constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  File motions within 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel T. Schreiner in court with attorney Patrick W. Waters.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges in Amended Complaint/max. penalties and rights including the right to a Prelim. Hrg.  Defendant waives right to P.H.  files Waiver form with the Court.  Court finds defendant waives right to P.H. & binds defendant over for trial.  DA to file Information.  Arraignment scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel T. Schreiner in court with attorney Patrick W. Waters.  Jon Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Atty Waters to check on collateral issues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel T. Schreiner in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including right to Preliminary Hearing.  State requests $2,500.00 cash bond or $2,500.00 signature bond as long as it includes IDIP monitoring.  Court sets $2,500.00 cash bond or may be released on $2,500.00 signature bond with IDIP unit.
